author: squareduck
title: Game on!
review:
I was a little skeptical about this figure, being a big hockey fan. I was really surprised by how great this figure is. Granted the helmet cage looks far to footballish, but by swapping it out with a visor he looks perfect. The cage works well for a goalie figure though. The Hockey stick is fun and when placed in the figure's hand he can actually rip a decent slapshot with the black stud puck. The ice skates are actually very good and fit snugly on the feet. I had to run quickly back to the store to scrounge up a few more for my kids to play with and this figure is definitively the overall favorite in my house. I can only hope that a different color comes along for an opposing team to face off with.


Pros: Surprisingly fun and functional, great pieces and playability.

Cons: The mask really only looks good for a goalie.

Get the foil on!!

author: alva
title: Great Minifig
review:
I never intend to search for this minifig. The only reason for me to have one of them is because my mistake. I try to use my finger to determine the content of the packaging. Found out that the content is including a body armor, and assuming that the only one that have that is the Hazmat guy, I bought the package. Turn out, the content is not the Hazmat guy, but the Hockey Player.

But I am not dissapointed with this minifig. He really looks cool. The angry face really fit in with the image of a hockey player. I also like the color combination of dark blue and white. Finally, the wolf logo really complete this minifig as a great hockey player.

I also like the accessories that come with the minifigs. The hockey stick and the skates are both new, I never seen both of them in any set before this.

Really cool. I think you can build an army of this minifig. And with little modification, you can change him into another sport player. Probably a football player, or even a gladiator?

Great minifig!

author: vexorian
title: A great minifig by itself
review:
You know, if I could have picked a series 4 minifig, the Hockey player would have been among the last in my priorities. I am not a town guy and I am really not a sports guy either. I like space so I was targeting towards the scientist and Hazmat guy. But of course, blind packaging and the dot system is VERY hard to use, so I ended up getting this guy. I was pleasantly surprised.

There are very good things about this, first let me talk about the useful things for people that wanted sports minifigs. The wolf print in the armor is marvelous. And the uniform could as well be used for American Football as well. The skates are very well done molds, too bad there are no longer extras included in collectable minifigs.

Now on what is important for LEGO fans in general, specifically the more sci-fi oriented. The armor is a nice brick on itself if you wanted some way to make minifigs more menacing. The wolf printing may be too specific, but the back side of the armor does not have it. The color of the minifig is dark blue, which is something you won't find easily. The torso has no printing, which is probably good if you wanted a generic dark blue torso, but not so good if you wanted more detail. And of course, a dark blue helmet. Too bad it is of the kind that is not air-tight so it is not so useful for space unless you let the kind of willing suspension of disbelief that we used in SW and the first Space police III waves.

The thing that won my heart is the minifig's head print. It is a very well done tough-guy expression.

All in all , series 4 is a great series with many minifigs worth having, and the Hockey player does not let this trend down.

author: sideswinger
title: A great figure, with great pieces!
review:
So the eighth figure in the LEGO Minifigure Series 4 is the Hockey Player. He includes 9 pieces, retailed for three dollars, and was released in 2011. So let's take a closer look!

Starting him off, we have that amazing helmet. Of course, the best part is that awesome face shield piece, but the actual helmet base piece is pretty great too. It has a really nice dark navy blue color, which is not the most common piece for that color. Of course, though, the shield piece is the best part of the helmet. I love all the intricate holes in it and I love how you can see that angry face underneath. Also, it was a new piece, which is really cool as well.

Next is his face, which has a very fitting angry expression. I love those barred teeth, and I love how well it can be seen through the helmet. No alternate expression, which is a bit unfortunate, but it's okay since alternate expressions were rare back then.

Next we have that awesome breastplate, with that white wolf printing, and I really like how rounded the shoulders are. And what's even cooler is that the back of the breastplate has printing too, which is so awesome overall.

Next is his torso, which as far as I can tell, has no printing. It would've been nice to get printing on it, but to be honest, a plain dark blue torso isn't exactly common, so I can't really complain much there.

And finishing off the figure itself, we have his legs which do have exclusive printing. Those white shin guards do look nice, but it would've been cool to get side printing. It isn't a huge deal though, and printing on the front is fine with me.

Finally, we have his accessories, which are pretty incredible. I love that hockey stick so much, from the moulding on the handle, down to the curve at the end. And from my understanding, that piece was new and exclusive to the figure at the time of its release, so that's great. And even though it isn't shown in the image, he includes a plain black stud as a hockey puck. While a black 1x1 round tile would've worked better, it's incredible that they even took the time to include a puck at all. And if two wasn't good enough, this figure has those ice skates as well, which look incredible. Those were new for this series, as they came in another series 4 figure as well, and a review for that figure is coming in a while. But man, the effort put into this dude is outstanding.

And that's that! Overall, this is by far one of my favourites in the series, and I am just totally in love with how he came out. So much effort was put into him, that he might just be my favourite in the series. But that is it for this review! Check out my profile to know more about me, and read my other reviews as well. Thanks for reading!
